# Roleplay Rule 13 – Stick to Your Role
Each job in Prospect Sector exists to support **station progression** or **expedition gameplay**. While helping others is encouraged, you should not **take over another department’s responsibilities** unless there is a clear need.
Requesting a job change is allowed. This rule is relaxed if the station is **understaffed**, during **emergencies**, or when defending yourself.
Do not: - Perform another department’s core duties without reason - Insert yourself into specialized roles you are not trained for - Act as “security” in a game mode that has no formal security - Take over critical jobs simply because you want to
This rule is enforced **more strictly on MRP**.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - As an engineer, helping the bartender remodel or reinforce the bar. - As a bartender, renovating your workspace. - As a passenger, building harmless projects with provided materials. - As an engineer, reinforcing substations or improving airlock security. - As an atmos tech, improving atmospheric pipelines and systems. - As a passenger, defending yourself from someone who is attacking you. - As crew on an understaffed station, performing engineering tasks because no engineers exist.
### Prohibited: - As a passenger, reinforcing electrical infrastructure without engineering involvement. - As a passenger, acting as station law enforcement or “security.” - As a passenger, fighting on behalf of someone else in a situation unrelated to you. - Taking over essential department work while trained staff are present and available.
